result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper in court.  Attorney Kevin Alfred Martin in court for Joel Andrew Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney David L Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Present bond continued
Plea hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bond amended to signature bond
ALL PRIOR CONDITIONS REMAIN

Assistant District Attorney Aaron Linssen appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper in court, in custody. Attorney Martin appears with the Defendant. 
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond modified. See bond sheet.
Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Ryan M Spaude in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin Alfred Martin appeared by video for Joel Andrew Cooper. Court rec's Dr.'s report in lieu of testimony.  Defendant is competent.  Bond to be argued at preliminary hearing.  Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Competency hearing on July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney J. Foss Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper appeared by video, in custody @ BCJ.  Evaluator needs more time, court grants the request.  Defendant  requests a signature bond, Court denies.  Present bond continued
Competency hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Competency hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
requesting an extension to do the evaluation

Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper in court, in custody at the Brown County Jail. Attorney Kevin Martin appears via zoom for defendant. Present bond continued.  Court orders competency exam to be completed on defendant.
Competency hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Competency hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety.
Take all medications as prescribed

Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper in court with attorney Kevin Alfred Martin.  Defendant Joel Andrew Cooper in custody.  Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
